Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, location can't be beaten”
Reviews.Author: dragonzflame
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as my partner was competing in the Dextro Energy World Triathlon Sydney on Sunday 15 April. We picked it based on its location; it was only a few hundred metres from the hotel to the main part of town where the triathlon was running (and swimming, and cycling). We were pretty happy with the place - the shower was a little temperamental and would have benefited from a wipedown with some bleach to get rid of a little mould that was growing in the grout, and the bed was a bit harder than we'd have liked, but it was clean enough and for the money (booked through Wotif) we were happy. No cooking facilities apart from a jug and microwave but we didn't pay for that. Apart from being close to where the tri was held, it was in just a few minutes' walk of Sydney's main shopping areas as well, and we were happy to discover the free city shuttle bus, which you can get from the bus stop round the corner at Martin Place. I'd say this is totally ideal if you expect to get what you pay for - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & good service for price”
Reviews.Author: joe1026
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the center of the business district, just a 15 min walk from SOP & botanic gardens. Location is EXCELLENT and just a block away from Martin Pl station. Nice, safe area, and you can pretty much walk everywhere from here (though at night you might want a taxi to be on the safe side, specially if you're hanging out in Oxford St or King's Cross). Hotel staff was great and service excellent. Room was perfect and very well equiped. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Phillip Street Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne E
Reviews.Content: We felt that this hotel provided a good value for the price! If you're looking for an elegant hotel to relax in while on holiday, this would not be a good choice; however, if you are looking for an affordable (for Sydney) hotel that's within walking distance of many attractions, then this hotel is a wonderful choice. Our room was pretty basic, but very clean, very quiet, and a decent size for our family of three. We loved that it had a built in kitchenette, with a small fridge- perfect for having cereal with milk and juice in our room every morning. The bathroom was nice, with the best water pressure that we have ever experienced at any hotel- not sure if this was a fluke, but we loved it! There's a free downtown shuttle bus (the 555) that is just minutes away, at the back of the hotel- it takes you to the Circular Quay, the Martin Place shopping district, etc...we enjoyed taking it for a full tour on the first day, to get a feel for the city. Just note that it only runs late morning until late afternoon, and can get a bit crowded. Note also that there's a nice little food court just minutes away, underground at the Martin Place station entrance behind the hotel- perfect for coffee and a snack, or breakfast. Best of all, the service here was wonderful, with a very friendly staff. One of the staff members was so helpful, as she tried to find an alternative tour for us after ours was canceled the night before. Also, they offered to do a few loads of laundry for us when the guest washing machine broke down- we were very grateful! Only negative- the mattress in our room was quite firm, to the point of being uncomfortable- but after a full day of fresh air and sightseing each day, we were so tired that we fell asleep too fast to really make an issue out of it!

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy; Not a Comfortable Place For us”
Reviews.Author: SriLanka2010
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed at this property during 2nd week March 2012 for 04 nights; Possitive; Centrally located within walking distance to some of the attractions like Opera house, Botanical Garden, Hyde park; Museum, Sydney tower etc Very Nice, helpful and friendly staff. Negative; It look like hotel is located in 03-04 floor of a office like building and its just a place to have a room; nothing else. I thought his one is like motel Travelodge in USA; no comparison. Room was very gloomy and not comfortable at all. After 5 pm no place to eat unless you like bar food at the Bistro at ground floor. Price about AUD 160+ not worth for this room. we will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “simple but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Will de d
Reviews.Content: The travellodge on Phillip Street is a simple but comfortable hotel in the business district of the town and on walking distance from Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The rooms are large and comfortable and the bathroom is alright, although the cleaner could have taken a little more time to clean the floor during my stay. The staff is friendly and there is a little bistro providing breakfast in the morning. There also is a casino with a bar and lounge and a bottlestore in the hotel. There are internetterminals on the 6th floor for 6 Dollars an hour. In Darling Harbour you will pay only 2 Dollars an hour in the shopping mall. The only minor point about this hotel was that the washing machine was broken during my entire stay and apparently couldn't be fixed. This Travellodge is a save and avordable option when staying in an expensive place like Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: NeilPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Close to main city shopping and Circular Quay. We found the reception very good and helpful and attached to a Club, casino etc. Meals we had there were good although I think you could do better having breakfast elsewhere. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I said we will be back, and we have been - twice!”
Reviews.Author: peachtreejan
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location with helpful, pleasant reception staff. No fuss this time when we asked to change from twin beds to queen, personal escort to ensure we were happy with our new room. We have travelled extensively here and overseas - if this sort of reasonable, clean, comfortable and affordable accommodation was available in most CBDs we would be most happy. There is everything one needs and if I wanted larger wardrobe space and larger room in similar location I would expect to pay more. The club in same building makes it easy to get a meal, the convenience store is a couple of doors away, cafes abound nearby. It is close to Macquarie streets medical specialists and this made it easy for my husband to walk to and from after day surgery, and was a quiet room for him to rest and recover. This is a good hotel where location, location, location is everything. We hope (medically), we won't be back for that reason but we know where it is for another reason. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: FionaA78
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Philip St Travelodge for an extra long weekend in Jan 2012. We had a few initial problems upon checking as they didn't have a twin room prepared only doubles. The reception staff were most accommodationg and personally went up to sort out our room so we could check in. The room was a decent size with comfortable beds, a great bathroom and fabulous shower. It isn't 5 star luxury but it was clean, relatively spacious and very comfortable. All up for the great location central in the Sydney CBD and the incredibly reasonable price this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant for the price”
Reviews.Author: spirited74
Reviews.Content: A central comfortable clean hotel with helpful informative staff, very thoughtful,as well as the tea/coffee/sweetner sachets, there was washing liquid /tea towel/dish cloth, so with the local supermarket 2 mins away and the microwave you could easily become self catering! we considered it in this very EXPENSIVE city! we stored our cases when we booked out for 5 hours before we headed off to our cruise, and they stored them again on our return for 6 hours (2 weeks later) before we went to the airport!! now some hotels charge to store your cases if you turn up EARLY for your room! within the hotel was NSW bistro .. umm cheap n cheerful, we had breakfast there once, but its good to have the option available. I was very impressed with this hotel, the room was spacious, the bathroom was modern/clean and of a reasonable size, I will recommend it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: soloszy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a central position to visit all the attractions most only 10 to 15 mins walk The bistro on the ground floor offers good value for food Steak and chips $10 and the NSW Club offers inexpensive drinks Staff very helpful, rooms clean and well equiped. First room we were offered had a dripping noise but without hesitation changed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - reasonable price (for Sydney)”
Reviews.Author: John_Beccles
Reviews.Content: Acceptable hotel in central Sydney. Easy walking distance to the main attractions - Opera House, Botanic Gardens, Harbour Bridge, the Rocks, Harbour Ferries, etc. Room was adequate for a three night stay. Coles supermarket close by on King Street. Be prepared to pay cash for your stay - there is a 1.5% surcharge for credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Otherwise reasonable hotel marred by a particular front desk agent.”
Reviews.Author: TomMiale
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Expensive. No complimentary WiFi or breakfast. Helpful front desk staff w. the exception of one particular oriental front desk man who I had the misfortune to encounter after a sleepless night on a cramped 14+ hr. transpacific flight from LAX. Wake up call did not work due to defective room telephone. However, front desk people fixed the problem by personally knocking on my door. Library nearby offers complimentary WiFi as does "Society Coffee House" The latter has an unfriendly manager and staff and is over priced, however. Clean and spacious room provided which more than made up for shortcomings but price was similar to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located to visit the center of town by foot”
Reviews.Author: Carlos_R_888
Reviews.Content: When I searched a hotel in Sydney for two nights on our way frm Europe to New Zealand, my aim was to find a centrally located hotel frm which we could easily walk to the Opera House, the Botanic Gardens, the wharf. On top of all that, Phillip Street is also at two minutes walk from the St James railway station. The train from the airport stops there. Perfect ! The rooms are modern and large enough. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I strongly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price very good, average room”
Reviews.Author: MandySSS
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the perfect location and one of the best deals in the CBD this is the place.If you are looking for a upscale place look somewhere else.My wife and I(who is from Sydney) spent 110 a night for 4 nights and it was perfectly located within walking distance to everything in the downtown area, that is if you like to walk(not a problem for us).The room was clean but the A/C hardly worked at all,even on full blast all day.Basicaly it is the best deal we could find in the heart of the CBD if you are looking for a clean no frills room, but if you are looking for something else go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: KylesMac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at the Travelodge in January 2012. We booked direct with the hotel and paid a little over A$200 per night. We had our 7 year old daughter with us and the room had a double bed in it and a fold out sofa bed. The room was quite small and with the three of us plus our luggage it felt very cramped as there is only a small chest of drawers and a very narrow wardrobe space. There were quite a few issues with our room which given the price of the room we were a bit annoyed about. First, when we opened the sofa bed we discovered that the sheets on it were dirty as they were full of food crumbs and hairs. Second of all, the shower when turned on screeched and groaned and was so noisy plus the actual shower head had to be held up in a certain position as it kept dropping down while you were showering. The bathroom floor was a bit dirty too in the corners and beside the toilet with bits of hair and debris. Our air con did not work properly, it wa set on 17 degrees Celsius but there was no way that the room was that cool, it was cooler in the corridors than the actual room and at night it felt hot and stuffy in the room. The blanket on the bed is one of those itchy woolen types and the bedspread had a large brownish stain on it in a very visible spot. As we were only staying at the Travelodge for 2 nights we did not bother to complain, we really only needed a place to sleep as we were out all day anyhow. But, for the price of the room I certainly expected a better standard as I have stayed all over Australia and overseasin hotels in a similar price range and experienced much nicer and better maintained rooms. I would not stay at the Travelodge again nor would I recommend them to anyone. The only saving grace was that the staff were very pleasant and helpful during check in and check out and that the hotel is located in a quiet street in a good location to transport and sightseeing in Sydney. We were located on the 9th floor and we did not hear any noise at all during our stay either from other guests or the street below.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Beagle007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the NSW Leagues Club. There is licenced bars, restuarants and poker machines, TAB and other amenities within this complex. The hotel does not offer a breakfast service. They rely in the amenities of the Leagues Club. The food is basic and not really appetising. However, the hotel has no control over this. I would suggest a short stroll to Sydney Tower - only 5 minute walk and enjoy the lavish opportunities within this complex. Back to the hotel. Great access when arriving at the airport. Cheap train fare and alight at the Martin Place station or St James station for a short walk to the hotel. Taxi access is easy as the inner city expresway exits in close proximity to the hotel. This will save you some money when coming to or from the hotel to the airport - make sure you tell the driver you want this option! The check in process was simple and professional. The rooms are basic. I think it is time for a refurbishment and update. I have been a regular traveller to this hotel now for 6 years. Nothing much has changed in this time. That is not to say the amenities are not clean and fresh. The hotel is very central to access to good shopping and Sydney Tower. Despite previous reviews it is not a bad spot to be located to move around Sydney. It has direct access to the Sydney City Circle (underground railway) that will get you around all areas of Sydney city, cheaply and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel - very very basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: bristraveller
Reviews.Content: Got booked in here for work as punishment for getting my travel forms in late! The lobby has a bad smell from the NSW Leagues Club which shares the premises. My room didn't smell but my colleague said hers did. Room was fine but very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frances F
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Travelodge, location great but a bit far away from dining and entertainment areas.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, fair pricing”
Reviews.Author: Alan_490416
Reviews.Content: It's a budget hotel and you get exactly what you pay for ie. a small but clean room. Plus points are the excellent location (15 minutes walk to the harbour, 5 minutes to Hyde Park), the basic but friendly "Bistro" which does a nice breakfast, and complimentary access to the NSW Leagues Club (whatever that is) bar which serves affordable beer. Allowing for the price we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MNova
Reviews.Content: I believe hotel rates are high in Sydney, and this is a budget hotel. So we get what we've paid. The room was unbelievably small, but clean. The only facility was an internet cafe and a great value bar. This hotel was pack with tourists and the walls was not exactly soundproof. Just spent your time outside if you want to have fun, come back late when you extremely need to rest, ignore the drunk tourists and you'll be fine staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelingKiwis
Reviews.Content: We visited Sydney for a family wedding and needed to stay within Central Sydney for the following reasons. Handy to transport, handy to shopping centres and within walking distance to the must see beautiful Sydney harbour. Our stay at the Phillip Street Travel Lodge was perfect. Staff at the Hotel very helpful and professional. Our room was great spotlessly clean and comfortable. Not a huge room however more than enough space for the two of us. We walked comfortably to the shopping malls and Darling Harbour, walked past the venue for Jersey Boys (perfect spot if going to the stage show). Our taxi was organised for an early start on leaving and everything went well. A bonus being with the RSL club with breakfast and meals nearby if you wish. Our room was very quiet no city noise. A great stay in Sydney and would return and stay again at Phillip St Travel lodge

Reviews.Title: “convenient stop over for sydney”
Reviews.Author: 1960-Gran
Reviews.Content: stopped at the travelodge Phillip St, sydney for the night due to bussiness. The travelodge is part of the NSW Legues club so you don't have to go anywhere to have a drink or meal. The parking is in Elizabeth Street which is just around the corner and underground Valet parking for $25 for the night. We asked for late checkout as we had bussiness to do early that morning and this could be accomodated for no extra cost. Overall a very handy place to stay if you have bussiness to do.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: RedRH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge Wynyard in November 2010, but coudn't get in for my latest trip to Sydney, November 2011. I was so happy with the Wynyard hotel, that I decided to stick with the Travelodge brand and booked myself into their Phillip Street hotel. I was expecting the same as what I got at Wynyard, but this wasn't nearly as good, and it was dearer. Firstly, I was unaware that some of the rooms did not face the street. I got an inside room facing a covered courtyard and apart from not seeing what the weather would be like on a day-to-day basis, the room was darkish. Furthermore, there were no refreshments in the mini fridge on arrival, whereas at Wynyard, there was plenty (coffee, tea, biscuits, chips, chocolate, water, wine, etc). I paid $25 extra a night to stay at this hotel than the Wynyard one (granted I got the Wynyard deal on special) and I feel that I did not get my money's worth. Room service consisted of placing an order with an outside restaurant (the hotel does not seem to have a kitchen, the Wynyard one does) and then waiting an hour and a half for it to come (wrong meal delivered, but not the hotel's fault). On the positive side, the hotel is centrally located and close to the shopping precinct and only a 15 walk from the harbour. Also, there didn't seem to be a fan in the bathroom, which got very sticky. I left the bathroom door closed when showering as I didn't want to set off smoke detector alarms. If I were to stay again, I would be requesting a room with more light and I would hope i would be getting more for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: ExcitedTraveller1973
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Travelodge Phillip Street for four nights with my 6 year old daughter and my friend and her daughter. Fantastic location - very handy for shopping, quick bus trip to Circular Quay and train station about a minute walk away. A little confusion over the set up of our room, but this was soon sorted. Very obliging for additional towel requests and things like that. It's not a flash hotel, but does the job very well and I think the price and location more than makes up for it not being so modern. Plenty of eating places all around this area. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would more than happily use it again for any future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced in the city”
Reviews.Author: misatok579
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge on 2 separate occasions - once as a family and the second time just my husband. Our first stay was wonderful - we had 2 large, clean rooms to fit our 5 family members and the staff brought us a crib for our youngest. The area was quiet and after our children settled down to sleep, we had a relatively nice night. The rooms included flat screens, microwaves and kettles for tea/coffee. There were also vending machines and ice machines down the hall. What we paid for the rooms was great and filled our needs nicely. The biggest plus is the fact that it's just down the road from the Sydney Consulate, so if you have business there, then this is the PERFECT place for you. It's about a 5 min. walk away. My husband's solo stay here wasn't as pleasant as he was stuck in a room with almost no air and when he requested another room, was given one that was pretty much the same and very small. Overall though, it's not a bad place to stay and it's very close to the consulate so I recommend it for people on a budget, as well as though that are visiting the consulate.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney central”
Reviews.Author: b_and_d_nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights as part of a recent holiday around Australia. We were looking for a reasonably priced, simple, comfortable place in the centre of Sydney, which was convenient to a subway station. In short, this Travelodge met all these requirements, and we were very happy with our stay there. The hotel is located fairly close to the CBD, about 1 or 2 train stops away from it. Martin place station is literally only a few steps from the hotel, making it extremely convenient to get around. The room was quite large, and we particularly liked the artwork in the room and along the corridors. The bed was comfortable and adequate for a good nightâ€™s sleep. We were on the 7th floor and noise from the street down below was never noticeable. The shower had good water pressure, and a handy shelf within to put your various shower amenities upon. Thereâ€™s a fairly large TV and plenty of coat-hangers too. Check-in and check-out process was hassle-free. In conclusion, we had a comfortable stay here with no troubles, and if youâ€™re not looking for something flash, we would highly recommend this place as a very convenient and mid-priced hotel in central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: waves32
Reviews.Content: Room was clean. Staff friendly, Location was great....but you cant compare it to Travelodge Wynyard (which also has a great location). I assumed that all Travelodge's would have the same protocols but sadly i was mistaken. Never greeted as my o.s visitors and i walk into building,no suggestions upon arrival, restaurant is more like a school cafeteria, room service is microwavable meals from reception, fold out bed was extremely uncomfortable. Wynyard must have some sort of policy of all staff recognising, assisting and greeting guests whenever they see you, be it in the hallway, lift, reception, outside, restaurant....whereas Philip St feels more like a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Another positive review”
Reviews.Author: ChoochCanberraACT
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of August. Well located , good value, clean and friendly staff.The rooms are not large but do have a small kitchenette Enjoyed our Thai and Steak sandwich at the NSW Leagues Club-wine is very well priced. After a day out we were happy to eat in. Sydney has a free bus in the CBD (555) which travels between Central Station and Circular Quay. Manly ferry trip is a great way to see the Harbour and is only $13,40 return. Traffic noise in the rooms is no worse than staying in any other large city

Reviews.Title: “Australia was amazing, but Travelodge was a dud...”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity003
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. It was expensive for what was offered. I was expecting at least the standards of a 'Best Western' type discount hotel, but felt almost as if I was in a student type dorm. Yes, my room was private, it felt very bare bones, functional and utilitarian, but not warm or inviting. It was clean, but did not feel comfortable. The area although not far from t he downtown, felt 'seedy' and run down. My travel agent suggested the Ibis at Darling Harbour, but the reviews were better for Travelodge. Mistake. I'm so sorry that I did not book the Ibis for the same money when I had the chance. I did not opt for the $17.00 buffet breakfast. Not worth the money. I found better fare nearby at another hotel. I enjoyed such wonderful places in my travels through Australia, and felt so at home everywhere I stayed but here in this barren, institutional, awful place. Do your homework and seek better accommodations. I think I would have enjoyed a hostel better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great mid priced hotel , great location to Theatre Royal & Westfield”
Reviews.Author: stacomagirl
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter & I stayed here for 1 night on 30th July to see Jersey Boys & have a girls shopping weekend. Perfect location , 1 min walk from Martin Place station , practically behind the Lindt cafe on corner Phillip St & Martin Place, expensive cafe but yummy , special treat. Paid $165 for a twin room. Pleasantly surprised when we entered the room (913 on the top floor , I think.) Nice clean room ,small but ample ,had a kitchen sink & cutlery & crockery which is nice to have, also a dining table & 2 chairs , even a microwave. Had a comfy chair & beds were reasonably comfortable, although just single size not king single like some hotels, but that's OK.Good sized shower with good pressure & plenty of hot water. Only 2 problems we had -it was un unseasonably warm that day & the air conditioning was not cold at all, it was cooler in hallway than in our room & the room we had was an connecting one & even though I put a blanket under the door to fill in the gap we were both literally woken at midnight by the person in the next room repeatedly turning a light switch on & off. Obviously the cavity/wall isn't soundproofed.The hotel itself is nice & quiet & Phillip St was not very busy on weekend so no road noise at all . It was very convenient having a club bistro on site & we stayed in for an early night & got a tasty hamburger & chips for only $11.50. We even won some of our dinner money back with a $5 dollar pokie flutter. Easy walk to Westfield & QVB & only about 600m to Theatre Royal . Also a convenience store in the same street very close by.Reception staff were all lovely & they stored our luggage for us when we arrived too early for check in & also on the day we checked out while we were at the Theatre.Would definitely stay again but perhaps not in summer, would try to not book a connecting room though as we are light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, central locatoin”
Reviews.Author: DanDawn
Reviews.Content: Stayed Friday and Saturday night as in Sydney for wedding. Great value for money, quiet room, had everything we needed. 10 minutes walk from shops - Westfield and Queen Victoria Building, Circular Quay, Rocks etc. Mid range accommodation but would definitely return to stay at this hotel. NSW Rugby League HQ in same building so handy having club on ground floor for a quick drink and club prices.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: peachtreejan
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is prime and the cost was very reasonable compared with the competition. The room was quiet, very clean and I believe recently refurbished. Besides being in the centre of the city it was also close to city medical offices/hospitals and just a short walk for my husband to have day surgery at the Retina Clinic. It is connected to the NSW Leagues Club where we had a great breakfast and dinner at reasonable prices. We were not disturbed as requested and the room had all usual facilities. The staff were very helpful and there was no need to ask them to care for our bags after we checked out so that we could get to the clinic for post operative check up - just offered when reception clerk saw his eye patch. When we had a message at reception, we would be advised across the TV screen. We have travelled extensively both in Australia and overseas and highly recommend this hotel if one wants good location, service, excellent room especially for the price. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: travel_while_we_can
Reviews.Content: Finding a reasonably priced hotel in Sydney that's not a hostel is pretty challenging. We looked at other reviews and decided on the Phillip St. Travelodge and were not disappointed! The rooms were basic but very clean with a small TV and even a kettle and cutlery. The location was great, about a 15-20 minute walk to the harbour, the Botanic Gardens and the Opera House. Front staff were very pleasant and helpful. We never tried the restaurant as it always seemed empty. There was coin-operated internat access in the hotel but it was a little expensive so we went online at the nearby convenience store. Overall a great value for downtown Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jim100Uk
Reviews.Content: We're well used to staying in UK Travelodges so we expected to get something clean and functional however this was certainly superior to what I am used to at home. We stayed here for 6 nights en route to a long stay in New Zealand. The room was spacious and very comfortable and was equipped with microwave, fridge and sink. Air conditioning worked well (just as well as we had a mini heatwave at the end of January). Overall it was pretty quiet as well. The front desk team were all very helpful and were happy to advise and book trips. Superb location just of the main shopping areas (George St and Pitt St) and easy walking to Opera House, Bridge, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Botanical Gardens etc. etc. Internet was expensive BUT if you walk down to the Apple shop in George Street then you can access the internet for free on a shiny new macbook - can get a bit busy though :-) I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: RBH1
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for value and location. I spent 8 nights at the hotel from May 1-9, five days for work and three days for touring, and was very pleased. It is not a full service luxury hotel in that you will not be pampered, there are not any bell hops or lots of staff, no room service, but you are not paying luxury prices either. It was clean, very quiet, and comfortable. The rooms are nice and well kept-up but plain, The desk staff were most pleasant and helpful. Sydney is an incredibly expensive city and I certainly was pleased with the price. I am confused by another review who was on the same 8th floor as my room and at the same time, because I never once experienced the smells they noted in either my room or the hall. However I was never there in the daytime so maybe they picked up something from the rather busy NSW club that takes up the bottoms six floors of the building. The climate control system in my room worked perfectly. Location was spectacular, right beside parks so you can go running down towards museum and botanical garden with only hassling with a couple of lights. Everything seemed to be within reasonable walking distance. I did not use the NSW club that takes up the bottom floors at all. I most highly recommend this hotel to a budget minded traveler who wants a nice, convenient, clean, quiet room. Bonus tip: Saap Thai diner, 378 Pitt St. Doesn't look like much from the outside (or inside), just a very plain appearance, but food was reasonably priced and outstanding. It is not exactly close but well worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: sues82
Reviews.Content: Very happy with all aspects of my stay. Would recommend for tourists as location is fantastic within easy reach of sites. Room was clean and staff were helpfull and very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASIC LOCATION FOR REGULAR TRAVELLERS TO SYNDEY CBD”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Burke001
Reviews.Content: I use this most tell on a regular basis when travelling to Sydney CDB. Its situated within walking distance of most major venues and public transport as well as taxi services are frequent and virtually right at the door. Staff are always highly professional and friendly. The rooms are of a reasonable standard for the price paid, given such an excellent location. Discounted secure carparking is next to the complex and the abundance of public tranport and ease of walking can see you lock the car safely away for your stay. On the occassion I have had to speak with staff about an issue - I find that they always recifiy the issue very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Ladybentley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before boarding a cruise. Location was excellent as itâ€™s quite central and easy to get to most places. If you are catching the airport train into the city, get off at St James station and itâ€™s a few minutes walk. Itâ€™s an easy walk to Circular Quay, and the main shopping area the other way. As reported, the hotel is above the League Club but you canâ€™t hear anything from the floors below. We asked for a quiet room and were given one looking onto the very pleasant glass roofed atrium which had been made into a pebble garden with potted palms and decorated with a trompe lâ€™oeil painting of a building with arches looking out to sea. It was very quiet indeed and we never heard any noise from outside. The room was fairly small and was mostly taken up with the king bed but there was room for an armchair and a small table and 2 chairs to eat at. But there was no drawer space and only a very small cupboard to hang clothes in. Everything was clean and looked to be fairly new. The nice bathroom only had a shower which we find preferable to climbing in and out of a bath to have a shower. Plenty of hot water with good pressure. However they were rather miserly with the towels etc. There was no hand towel and only one washcloth plus only one small soap was provided. We would have liked one for the shower as well one for the basin. We were given a second washcloth after we asked but after two days it was taken away and we were back to one again. The kitchenette is just a bench with a kettle, a microwave above, a small fridge below, and furnished with some dishes and cutlery. Not really enough to cook anything but very useful for storing and reheating food. There are two food outlets downstairs. We didnâ€™t have breakfast at the cafÃ© and thought the food for the dinner we had there was only OK for the prices they charged. But the dinner we had from the Thai place (only open on Thursday nights) was very good at a great price. Service from the desk staff and the manager was very friendly and helpful. We had received an email a couple of days beforehand checking what bed configuration we wanted. We asked for a Queen or King if possible and were very pleased be given a comfortable King (two twins bed joined together). This hotel charges reasonable prices (for Sydney hotels which are very dear) and we felt it was good value for a comfortable, clean place to stay. We would definitely stay there again at the right rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Louise12358
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this Travelodge. The rooms were exactly as seen on the screen. Very clean. The Staff are very friendly. We had a burnt out light bulb in the bathroom which we mentioned on our way out. When we got back it was fixed. Sydney is a lovely place to visit and this accommodation just enhanced our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RhodanNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and found it to be OK overall. The room was not newly refurbished as stated on their website, the bathroom looks a bit tired and could do with a makeover. The room size is fine for 2 people. The housekeeping could have been better, as we noticed they had not washed the cups one day, and just placed them back in the cupboard. It was also extremely noisy earling morning, from about 5am with all the construction and rennovations going on in Phillip Street. If you looking for a place to stay whilst on holiday that is decently priced and that is in a great location (only 10min walk to Circular Quay, Martin Place train station 2min walk), then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again if they were not always booked out !!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheap101
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for Bridge Climb, easy access to major attractions and made a profit on my stay and meals with a nice little win down stairs in the club ! had a great time :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value at a great location in the central business district”
Reviews.Author: spanky50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed for doing business in the central district of Sydney. The parks and opera house are nearby and are easily walked to. There are plenty of good places to eat nearby. The hotel has good beds, quiet rooms without street noise, and helpful staff. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: melbguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge for Mardi Gras 2011 in Sydney. It's a clean, functional budget hotel with friendly and knowledgeable staff. Our first room looked out towards Elizabeth St, which was so noisy that I couldn't sleep (even though we were on the top floor). We then changed to a room overlooking the inner courtyard, which was very quiet. Rooms are quite spacious and have everything you need. Not a luxury hotel by any means but good, reasonably priced accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “central location ideal for visiting all the sights”
Reviews.Author: jofife
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room in an ideal central location within easy walking distance of all the sights. We didn't use the restaurant but there were lots of cafes close by serving great coffee and croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyLulu
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for one night only as it was the closest location to a function I was attending. I booked through wotif.com and was surprised at the mid-week price which was more than I've previously paid for top class 5 star hotels in the central city. The staff were pleasant and helpful but i found the room to be dreadful. My first warning all may not have been well was the strong smell of air freshener in the room - of the type used by cheap hotels/motels to attempt to overpower less than pleasant smells but didn't quite succeed - would rather have been able to open a window for fresh air. There was a small kitchen which, thankfully, I didn't need to use. The only item from the kitchen I tried to use was a drinking glass which had been returned to the cupboard without being washed as it still contained the dregs of something unidentifiable - doesn't housekeeping check these things?! Internet was an additional cost of an outrageously overpriced amount.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise - good value - excellent CBD location”
Reviews.Author: Cruzers174
Reviews.Content: This was our first-ever trip to Sydney. We stayed three nights at the Travelodge Phillips Street prior to a cruise, and were pleasantly surprised as it was great value for the money. The staff was excellent; the room was smaller, but very clean and it had a mini frig and microwave along with dishes and cutlery; and the downtown location was within easy walking distance of the Parliament House and the Botannical Garden and even the Opera House for the more adventureous walkers. This hotel is owned by the NSW Leagues Rugby Club, and the first four floors are used for the offices and club lounge and casino, but noise was never an issue as the patrons never get rowdy. In Australia, these private clubs are places where husbands take their wives for a nice meal and evening out without having to mortgage their homes. As a hotel guest, you get to use the facilties, which include a Bistro, a couple of bars and casino with slots. Drinks are discounted and we enjoyed two excellent dinners in the Bistro for about $15 each which was about half the charge of a downtown restaurant. Breakfasts in the Bistro were quite expensive, so we simply went elsewhere or had cereal in our room. Sydney itself is an excellent city to visit, and we would recommend that you take the two-part double decker bus tour to get an overview of the city. It was a very positive experience, but this hotel would not appeal to patrons who have only the very highest 5-star expectations and who have the financial resources to pay for them. For the rest of us ordinary folk, it was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: elle_g11
Reviews.Content: Being a teenager traveling solo, I didn't want to stay too far away from the main attractions, but still had to find somewhere fairly affordable. I stayed here for just one night, and found the room and bathroom quite simple but nicely organised and clean. The room did seem slightly small when I first walked in, and if I had lots of luggage I'd struggle for space. The hotel is near Martin Place, mainly a business district, so the view out of my window was nice too (tall buildings and the like). Market Street, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, The Opera House and the Botanic Gardens are all within walking distance, so that was really good for me. The Monorail is also nearby, being the City Centre stop, as well as the train station outside of Hyde Park (barely a 5 minute walk). My stay at Travelodge Phillip Street was enjoyable, and even though it cost a little more than what I would usually pay, I think it was mostly worth the money :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: TheRocksKiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights here and couldn't really fault it. The hotel itself is located on the 5th+ floors of the NSW Leagues Club and you can use the club facilities (bar etc) whilst there. We didnt take up this offer though as we went out most of the time. The rooms were a decent size and our room was a twin with two double beds. The bathroom was also a decent size with a large walk in shower. We also had a small kitchenette and modern furnishings and 32' flat screen tv. The decor has been refurbished and it feels quite modern so was really a great room for the price. I can recommend if you want to be in the centre of the city as its at the top of Hyde Park and close to the main shopping area plus a short walk to Martin Pl Station or St James Station. We will most likely stay there next time we are in Sydney - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & good value. Walking distance to attractions.”
Reviews.Author: LittleMsMe
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business. Cheapest nightly rate amongst hotels nearby. Really good value considering central location. Meals at NSW Leagues Club (ground floor at the hotel) decent & honestly priced. Medium size, clean rooms, low key decor, no complaints. Reception staff approachable and accommodating. Suggest try the Lindt's cafe at the hotel corners for a breakfast splurge. Chocolates there are fantastic! Would stay there again. Book stay via the hotel website on Tuesdays (for any days stay) as they give better deals. Also, book 7 or more days in advance and there is no extra charge for credit card payment (at the present).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: OrangeKiwi14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in central sydney and is a very reasonable price. Not a super fancy place, staff could do with being a bit more attentive, but in general is nice and clean. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate. Best deal I could find in CBD. Location was handy”
Reviews.Author: TravelerNotTourist69
Reviews.Content: I searched Tripadvisor and used Priceline to no avail so I settled on this place for 3 nights as I wanted something confirmed. We arrived Sydney about 26 hours after leaving home and could not get into our room right away so they held our luggage while we got brunch. Avoid the coffee shop attached to this location. This place has a dingy small casino attached 1000 approx sq ft. Never used it. There was a deli in the basement of a department store a couple blocks away (David Jones) which was kind of nice for quality food on the cheap . Plenty of other places within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “ok budget hotel but some details could be better”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: Location is downtown, in the business district, with views of office blocks. That's fine at this price point, as, even if you're a tourist, it's still convenient. The ground floor doubles as the entrance to a gaming club so don't expect any glitz or glamour in the lobby (but again, that's in the price!). Check-in was ok, though rather spoilt by being told there was a 1.5% surcharge for using a credit card. Very cheeky, and the first time I've come across this in a first-world country for decades. The clerk mumbled something about "banks", but all banks charge merchants the world over for credit card charges - it's a cost of doing business - and it's unacceptable for a hotel to chisel an extra charge from its guests for this. It's like levying an extra charge for clean laundry. The room was perfectly comfortable, with a small kitchen area and good work space. There was a kettle, but no long bath (only a shower - however, an excellent shower with lots of power and stable hot water flow). The bathroom and the room were both well lit. The LAN port (clearly marked "data") didn't work, and neither did the phone. I had to schlep down to reception to sort it out, to be told (in a "sigh... some people just don't understand technology" tone of voice) that if I connected a data cable to the data port it wouldn't work, and would disable the phone to boot. Annoying. The wireless internet is slow and expensive (A$20/day) but it does work. Given that you're face to face with office blocks, you need to use the net curtains unless you feel like some performance art to entertain the office workers! There are also good blackout curtains if you're jetlagged or terminally hungover. The windows don't open but the aircon controls worked fine. The first bill the hotel prepared for me charged my three times for 24 hours' internet connection (for an overnight stay). Although they fixed it quickly it would have saved time and paper if they'd checked first. Otherwise checkout was fine, and on returning to collect my bags I was invited to use the disabled toilet to change - not high luxury but practical I guess. All in all this was a functional hotel, and appropriate value for money, but the staff don't really care about your experience and I'd suggest you only use this for an overnight stay for a business trip or after a night out. And argue about the 1.5% gouging!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brebs
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms had everything you needed, ideally situated with the underground just across the road and the opera house about ten minutes away on foot, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I have expected”
Reviews.Author: Efdinal
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with this hotel. I stayed there from 07/10/2010 - 13/10/2010. I booked directly via internet about two weeks before my arrival. Everything much better than I have expected. The room was quite and newly renovated. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was very clean, kitchenware was more than we need. We stay at 8th floor and view to Sydney Tower. Reception staff, Erik was very polite, friendly and helpful. He allowed us to check in at 10:00 A.M even though normal check in time was 02:00 P.M. and we could take a rest after 7 hours flying from Jakarta. The hotel located in the fine part of Sydney, surrounded by shopping malls (Jones/Myer/etc), fine boutiques, near to (short walking distance) most tourist attractions such as circular quay, Sydney tower, Hydepark, etc. If you don't like walking, the hotel is also near to Martin Place Railway Station and St James Station. I would certainly comeback and be happy to recommend this hotel to my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, cheap and nasty”
Reviews.Author: MCTHUK
Reviews.Content: Stank of cigarette smoke. Not very good noise insulation between the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room had everything I needed”
Reviews.Author: hayleyrh_94
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Sydney for 3 nights having a break from staying with friends in Melbourne. I changed my booking to this hotel just 2 weeks before I left the UK after reading reviews of the hotel I had originally booked and comparing prices I decided this hotel would be better on the pocket and the comfort! The room was clean with the added bonus of a fridge, sink, microwave, cutlery & crockery. So, I bought milk, cereal and some orange juice from the little shop next to the hotel and was able to feed myself each day before heading out and save myself the cost of eating breakfast out and about. The location of the hotel was great. The road it was on was very quiet, surrounded by offices - I stayed over a weekend so it may have been a little busier during the week. I could be at Sydney harbour in less than 10 minutes and in the main shopping area in even less. I think the location was great for me and I felt perfectly safe walking back to the hotel after dark. I paid about Â£50 per night for this hotel and considering it's central location I consider it to be very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Vanmerino
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a business colleague to stay 9 nights in Sydney. It was perfect and, given the location, extremely good value. I had quite a lot to do with the hotel staff in the course of his stay and they were extremely helpful and attentive. The room was very nice and my colleague said the hotel was quiet and comfortable. We ate in the "reastaurant" which is actually the bistro of the Leagues CLub on the ground floor of the building - its not fancy but its cheap and cheerful. Overall an excellent value hotel in the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in good location”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a <$100 / night hotel in a convenient tourist area in Sydney, this is it. The hotel is a block away from Hyde Park, and in 15 minutes, you can walk to Circular Quay / Opera House, The Rocks, the Botanical Gardens, the Aquarium / Darling Harbor, and the downtown shopping area. It's a few extra minutes to Chinatown and Paddy's Markets, but you get the idea, it's close to everything. The location is particularly nice if you want to take night pictures. The hotel has a slightly unusual layout. It occupies the top (4?) floors of an office-ish building, with a rugby "club" and offices on the lower floors. Fortunately, the noise stays downstairs. The rooms are medium size but comfy, clean. There's a fridge and microwave, and vending and internet kiosk ($2 / 20 minutes). WiFi was available for $12/hr. There's free WiFi in the Customs House at Circular Quay and some nearby McD / cafes. The front desk staff was nice and helpful. There's a convenience store next door (they are everywhere in Sydney) and a couple of cafes (Silks, across the street, was good). A TV station is nearby if you're interested (with "Today" style windows) and several food malls for lunch if you're in the area (they tend to be underground in Sydney). There is a great Japanese restaurant nearby (Sushi Tei, on Elizabeth St) with very reasonable prices. It's more than sushi and you can eat there several times and have a great, different meal every time (if you're into Japanese food). There's a Thai restaurant at the hotel and a nice bar. All in all, it's a more-than-good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Short Stops”
Reviews.Author: jmfish63
Reviews.Content: Great motel for overnight stays. First visit we had a room on the sixth floor. Excellent. Very quite. Large room, sofa & small table with kitchenette. Older style but very clean. Second stay 3 weeks later were on the eighth floor. Room not as nice nor roomy. Sounded like we were at street level. Very very convenient to all attractions in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: Georgina1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, we chose the hotel based on it's location and we weren't disappointed. It is walking distance to most of the more famous sites in Sydney. As for the hotel itself, we weren't expecting much from a Travelodge but we certainly were not disappointed. The room was on the small side but was clean, comfortable and functional. In fact, we've stayed at some hotels on the upper end of the market and have never stayed in a city centre hotel that was so quiet! The staff were very friendly and willing to help despite some of the other reviews that we've read. We would certainly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in expensive city”
Reviews.Author: forfararab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March on our first visit to Sydney.We had breakfast and evening meals here and were pleasantly surprised. Breakfast was about A$12 and we had steak and chips for dinner at only A$10. O.K its not a 5 star restaurant but we enjoyed the informal atmosphere. The bar was large and quite busy but for some reason closed at 9.45pm on Tuesday and Wednesday. Prices here were A$3 for a large beer and very nice wine for A$4 served by a very pleasant Egyptian lady.Part of the bar had many poker machines but we didn't try these.We enjoyed the busy surroundings but escaped to the nearby Hyde park which was very relaxing. We spent some time on the hop-on-hop-off sightseeing bus,the Sydney explorer and the Bondi explorer. A very pleasant short break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your money”
Reviews.Author: MontrealPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location with the train station just next to Hyde Park or again in the other direction under Martin Place. The breakfast is good but not included and there are plenty of places nearby for breakfast and lunch. Most nearby restaurants close in the evening. The rooms are great, clean comfortable. The wireless internet is available for ~$8AUD/hr. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent value.”
Reviews.Author: RJP33
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is perfectly fine, great location just 10 minutes walk from pretty much everything centrally and a 2 minute walk from 2 tub stations. The rooms are the usual Travelodge rooms, functional as youâ€™d expect as is the place. Reception isnâ€™t the friendliest but nothing too bad, Value for money is good compared to the other hotels in the vicinity, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than UK Travelodges”
Reviews.Author: KimQueenofQuo
Reviews.Content: The hotelâ€™s location is great, within a short walking distance of many of Sydneyâ€™s sites including The Rocks, Darling Harbor, Hyde Park and Botanic Gardens. The hotel is close to Martin place station, where you can catch a train to Bondi, Hyde Park station where you can catch a train to the Rocks and a Monorail station near Market Street for trips to Darling Harbour. We stayed 3 nights to see Status Quo in concert. We were checked in very quick and the guy was very pleasant and knowledgable. We asked many questions over our 3 day stay. Our room was clean and a reasonable size. The air con was just right and we didnt need to alter it. We had a small kitchen area with a sink kettle refrigerator and microwave. There was always plenty of tea coffee sugar and milk. The bathroom was good and the shower worked well plenty of towels that were replaced daily along with the bins emptied. There was a hairdryer. Our room was quiet we never heard any noise. The bed was clean and comfortable. Pillows plenty of them and very comfortable. Much better standard than our UK Travelodges. TV worked ok and there were plenty of channels. We had breakfast in the small coffee shop/cafe the first morning which was cooked fresh so was warm and very nice although basic. Bacon and Eggs or continental was pretty much the choice. There is a convienince store near with Internet access at 20 minutes for $1

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDMAIL
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for four days in January 2010. I must say this hotel was very pleasent and me and my partner would strongly recomend any one visiting the city of Sydney, to stay here. The rooms were spacious with fridge and microwave, very clean and the room was cleaded on a daily basis. This hotel was great value for money and if your looking for a good hotel in Sydney, we would recomend this hotel. One last thing is this hotel is close to all attractions and the furthest we had to walk was about 20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room but all we needed”
Reviews.Author: PalladiumBride
Reviews.Content: After a very long flight from Canada to Australia, we were anxious to get from the airport to our room. However, upon arriving at the Travelodge late in the afternoon, we were disappointed to learn that our room wasn't ready yet and the front desk staff suggested that we leave our luggage behind the desk and go take a walk. We really just wanted to shower and take a nap! However, to their credit, when we returned we were given a room with a kind-sized bed (as opposed to two singles, which had been the only choice available when we had booked online). There is nothing at all fancy about this place but that suited us just fine as the price was reasonable and we knew we would be out from morning 'til night exploring Sydney, and really just needed a comfortable bed and a shower. It was a very basic room, but it was a convenient location for our first visit to Sydney (we could easily walk to the major tourist attractions, Circular Quay, Royal Botanical Gardens, and Darling Harbour, etc.) There is a very small restaurant located on site but after two 'so-so' breakfasts there, we preferred to find food elsewhere while we were out and about during the day. There is also a convenience store located next door and although we didn't use it, I believe they had internet access. There are certainly nicer hotels in Sydney but this was fine on a budget, since we were only there at night to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: scojoh
Reviews.Content: Pros ==== The hotel appears to have been recently renovated with new paint. Our room, though not large (which I would expect for Sydney) was clean, with a small Kitchenette that includes a microwave, fridge and basic cutlery. Our room we stayed in was quiet however we were located on one of the higher floors which might make a difference for noise levels. The staff are friendly and readily helped out with recommendations. The hotel is part of the NSW leagues club which has a restaurant and workout facilities. The hotel's price was reasonable for Sydney which can be a very expensive city for accommodation. The hotelâ€™s location is great, within a short walking distance of many of Sydneyâ€™s sites including The Rocks, Darling Harbor, Hyde Park and Botanic Gardens. The hotel is close to Martin place station, where you can catch a train to Bondi, Hyde Park station where you can catch a train to the Rocks and a Monorail station near Market Street for trips to Darling Harbor. I would definitely stay here again. Cons ==== I would not classify the Travelodge as a four * hotel, for example the towels and sheet are not quite as luxurious as you would expect to get in a 4*. It was not a problem for me, but the bed is really firm. The workout facilities in the NSW leagues club are an extra charge above your room rate. Philip Street is not the liveliest part of Sydney for night life, though you are very close to the Rocks and Darling harbor if you wish to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but bare living”
Reviews.Author: Katlesh
Reviews.Content: The travelodge is not my preferred choice of places to stay in Sydney. The rooms are perfectly clean and you have everything you need IE bed, toilet, shower....however it is just too white and stark and without personality for me. I like a place with a bit of character...and you certainly don't get this with a travelodge. But then again that is the price you pay for cheaper accommodation in the city. It was extremely handy for me to get to the office as it is right in the CBD. If you just need a cheap (ish) place to sleep in and you don't care about the decor or feel of the place then this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: PortAugustaMiller
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in this hotel.Just be aware that you can enter from the bottle shop entrance of the building as there is two Phillip Streets.The main entrance is around the back on the small Phillip Street side. Rooms were small , but great with everything needed.Rooms are cleaned every day and new towels supplied.They were very quiet especially with the location of the building. Downstairs there is a restaurant ,bars,pokies and bistro which is affordable. Around the corner are the Sunrise studio's if you want to meet Kochie,Mel and co. If you want breakfast go to the MLC Centre which is just located just down from the Channel 7 studio's on your left hand side. For sightseeing down at Darling Harbour,The Rocks,etc is only about 15 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: eijo48
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on the 5th floor.very Quiet. Left and booked into another hotel/apartment on the water front for 3 days. This was rubbish so came back to the Travelodge. This time we had a room on the street side. A wee bit noisey but ok. liked the idea of food down stairs where we ate every night. Also liked this Hotel as close to everything. Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Sidney”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMorrison
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Travelodge Phillip Street, I picked it after reading reviews here. The location can't be beat as you are a half-block from busy Martin Place with a subway station, and Circular Quay is also a short distance away (5 mins by bus, 15-20 mins walking). In fact all of downtown is pretty much within walking distance. The rooms are slightly small but very nice and clean. I stayed in 2 rooms, one on the 9th floor and one on the 7th. Both were a little different layout but equally satisfactory. The New South Wales Rugby Club has their offices in the building which gives the stay an interesting experience. Guests of the hotel are granted "temporary" membership in the club and you can eat in their basic but decent restaurant, drink at their bars, and gamble in their casino. If you like rugby, there is no doubt this is the place to stay as you can rub shoulders with people involved in the sport! The in-room internet was a little pricey at $12/hour so I used the business center computers instead which cost $6/hour. The only negative in the room was the bed - it had no spring, just a mattress on top of a wood frame!! Both rooms were the same. Wow, I hadn't seen that in a long time!! It didn't seem to affect my sleep, but beware. Also, this area closes up early and there aren't a lot of dinner restaurants to be found. It didn't bother me (I eat at Subway) but if you want nightlife this probably isn't the area for you. Side note, I would really recommend a Sydney Pass to see the city. It seems pricey at $115 for 3 days, but it includes all trains, buses, and ferries, plus 2 tourist Explorer buses, and a round trip to the airport. If you add it all up it's a bargain. I loved it. I rode the ferries many times, Sydney is an amazing city and the harbor is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Only in Australia”
Reviews.Author: Xamb
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Australia, and this hybrid hotel and rugby club bar and casino lived up to every stereotype. It really is a shock to walk in and realize the first reception desk you see it not the hotel's but the New South Wales rugby association, which is the primary activity on the premises. The decor is rugby rugged, and all the rules apply to who can be in the casino and in what attire. The restaurants are inexpensive but ugly and highly utilitarian, accessories to the main action, which is drinking and gambling. The Travelodge itself, which uses the upper floors, is indeed a bargain, and the location is extraordinary for the price. It is in walking distance of everything -- harbours, business center, public transporation, beautiful parks (don't miss the botanical gardens) and lots of restaurants, bars and coffee shops which offer much better food and atmosphere than the lifeless casino. If you don't have pretentious friends who will wonder why you (or your travel arranger) booked this odd facility, it is a very practical and economical way to have change in your pocket to experience Sydney's fantastic center city. Just don't plan to spend much time in the room or the hotel. They don't offer much to the international visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Sherpas
Reviews.Content: In the centre of the CBD and very convenient. Rooms are on the small side and have a microwave but with the Club on the lower level, very handy for meals. Only negative comment would be the reception staff advising on parking. Were given very vague information on the parking station next door that the hotel has dealings with - this needs to be clarified for guests as we had to struggle up two flights of very steep stairs with suitcases. If it's raining, not good as there's no direct access to the hotel from the parking station.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value - clean, safe, convenient, no fuss - very impressed”
Reviews.Author: MrPugsley
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel - it was a pleasant surprise, considering the relatively cheap rate and the great central location. Pros: clean, modern (looked recently refurbished), quiet, efficient unobtrusive check-in/-out, excellent location (quiet street in the CBD legal district but handy to everything); above a NSW leagues club (good facilities on-site - cafe, bistro, gym- but I noticed no noise upsatirs in my room from them); no mini-bar in the room (there's a vending machine on floor 6) Cons: no work desk; uses old-fashioned wool blankets instead of doonas with washable covers that can be changed between every guest I was really impressed by the room and the service. It was clean and the furnishings were modern and did not look worn. The carpet seemed new - deep, soft and clean. The water pressure and hot water were good, and the shower/bathroom had plenty of room. The shower floor is flush with the rest of the bathroom, which may improve accessibility for some people. The was some longer-term dicolouration of the grouting in the shower, but despite this, it looked very well cleaned. Everything in the kitchenette looked spotless (no stray crumbs in the cutlery drawer or spots of other guests' dinner in the microwave). The kitchenette is basics only - just for reheating a meal, not for cooking up your own (e.g. the implements are eating cutlery only and there is no toaster; no can opener either). The fridge was small but clean. You could fit a few ice blocks in the freezer, but nothing big. I really liked the fact there was no in-room mini-bar. The bed was basic. I hate those super-soft hotel beds you get in 4- & 5-star places. This was a firm bed with no sagging, covered with a thin mattress protector. It had crisp, clean sheets and a good-quality but well-used wool blanket. At home, I love these blankets, but not so keen in hotels, where I assume they are re-used between guests. That said - the blanket looked clean & I couldn't fault it. The pillows were newish, big and soft. The whole bed was covered with a modern but unobtrusive coverlet, with some extra throw pillows for day use, and the whole effect was clean and modern. The TV was flat-screen, with the basic free channels (but not their free digital counterparts) plus Fox Sports, plus a couple of other Fox channels. It didn't work when I arrived, so I called the desk and within 5 minutes the receptionist had come up and fixed it for me with no fuss (just a cord that had come out when the room was last cleaned). The lighting in the room is excellent. Sometimes the mood lighting in hotels is no good for working, but there are good strong lights above the bed, which is where you have to work because there is no desk. This is the biggest drawback of the room for business travellers, but working on the bed was not too bad. There was a power outlet next to the bed. The lack of a desk speaks to the smallness of the room. It wasn't claustrophobic, but was on the small side. I didn't find it detracted from my visit. Internet was expensive. You can use the in-hotel wifi or ethernet for approx $11.95 (?) per hour, or Telstra wifi for $5 for 15 mins, $8 for 30 mins (Telstra is slightly more expensive than the in-house provider for an hour). I used the Telstra service for short bursts and it worked well. You could control the heating and cooling in your own room with a digital thermostat/fan control. This worked well in my room and I was very comfortable. It was not too noisy - a sort of white noise in the background that made me feel like I was on a spaceship on an episode of Star Trek. I requested a quiet room if possible, and they listened. I was given a room at the very end of a hallway, far away from the lifts, and with only one neighbour. The room was fantastically, serenely quiet, with just the odd bit of noise when someone nearby opened/closed a door. The view I had was of offices on the opposite side of the street - pleasant and inoffensive. The location is great. I didn't have time on my work trip to sight-see, but could see quite a few sights just by wandering near the hotel on my way home in the evenings. The hotel is smack-bang next to a Lindt chocolate shop & cafe (joy!!) and the Channel Seven studio is 100 metres away at the end of the street (you know, where people peer in the glass at Martin place and make faces behind the Sunrise crew). The next street over has St James' church, Hyde Park Barracks, Sydney Hospital, NSW Parliament - just a beautiful spot to stay. The hotel seems to be in the legal district, and since Phillip St is not too wide, there wasn't too much traffic. There are a couple of supermarkets within 5 mins walking distance, and it's close to a couple of train stations (Martin Place and St James) if you want to get there from the airport on the train. Highly recommended - I will definitely stay here in future. I would even recommend it for personal trips where you are going to be out and sightseeing a lot. It's not the place to go for a romantic break where you want a bit of luxury and to spend a lot of time in the room, but it's great value for other purposes. Check-in and -out was efficient and friendly. I was able to check out just by handing over my door keycard and a signed invoice which was slipped under my door on the morning of departure. PS. Booking tip: you can book this directly online through the Travelodge booking website. Saves worrying about putting your booking through a third party like wotif, and you get the same rates as those sites anyway (there's a guarantee on the booking website).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: vivekgupt
Reviews.Content: Overall satisfactory stay for that price. Rooms sizes were small but still comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Devonian_A
Reviews.Content: This Travel Lodge was an absolute little gem of a hotel. We were quite nervous about booking 3* hotel but were were on an unexpected trip to Sydney and hence on a very tight budget. The staff were very good and helpful; they had met special request we had made for a quietly sited room. The hotel was very clean and the small kitchenette was good and helped with our tight budget. I consider this hotel to be more 4* than 3* in terms of the service it provides. Really liked the "wet room" style bathroom. Room/bed comfortable and there was adequate storage for our one week stay. The hotel is in a very good location for both walking to central Sydney main attractions, and for public transport to head further out. High speed internet available at a reasonable cost. Main Tips: Walk just one block down to find the Circular Route "Free" bus which takes you through to Central Station (when we were in Sydney the bus ran from 9.00 am to 6.00 pm but 9.00 pm on Thursdays). If visiting Blue Mountains on an independent trip, buy your ticket at the local tube station just beside the Hotel. This return ticket will then take you right through for the same cost as making your way to Central Station, then buying your Blue Mountain train ticket. The "Convenience Store" just along from the hotel is convenient but a bit expensive. However, prices acceptable if you are just buying cereals/milk/yoghurt for self catering breakfast - and it is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “no frills hotel, heart of Sydney, 10-15 min walk to EVERYthing -- CLEAN, QUIET”
Reviews.Author: crosvs
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy about this place: just a comfortable, quiet, super-coveniently located hotel right in the heart of Sydney, about 10-15 min walk from everything. At about $80/night, easily -- EASILY -- the most bang for your buck in Sydney. Extremely helpful front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “great place to discover or tour Sydney”
Reviews.Author: wotthe
Reviews.Content: My 13 yo son and I stayed at Travelodge Phillip St Sydney as we were going on our first trip to Sydney to see our opposition AFL football teams play at the SCG and we lucky enough to find a great starting base to see so many of Sydney's other wonders. The location is quiet but close to public transport and within walking distance of the major Sydney shopping area (south side - at least). We found the staff very helpful and the room clean and almost as described. Unfortunately the 'self-catering' aspect is not quite true. Our room had a fridge (very small), a micowave, and 3 x basic crockery and cutlery settings. A toaster and some additional cooking utensils would have been great. There is also a convienience store just near the main entrance where you can buy your own cereal/milk etc. However, given the cost ($135.00 per night) and great position, I can get over that slight exaggeration. We are intending to go back next year and will stay at the Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic, quiet location in city centre.”
Reviews.Author: Waiariki
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights after reading reviews on tripadvisor. Not "luxury" by its external appearance - it is the same building as NSW League Club - but perfect for an economical stay in the city centre. Rooms were clean and spacious with couch, dining table and basic kitchenette. We overlooked an internal atrium so not much natural light but extremely quiet as away from road noise. Meals and drinks in League restaurants and bar were very reasonably priced. We arrived by train from airport at St James station - a stone's throw from hotel. The Botanic Gardens were a 5 minute walk away so each morning started with a stunning walk through the gardens and along the waterfront. I would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hails_79
Reviews.Content: This is a simple hotel that is clean, comfortable and secure. The location is fantastic - only a 10 minute wander to Circular Quay, shopping, restaurants, etc. Service is good - staff very helpful. The rooms are neat, clean and fairly well appointed. Probably the only complaint is no room service for breakfast, but they do serve breakfast in the bistro downstairs. Excellent value considering the location. I will stay here again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: DeniseMichelle
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal- very close by to two train stations (one with a direct route to the airport), and just a couple of blocks away from the Royal Botanical Gardens. It was very convenient for me as a single traveler. The rooms were simple and relaxing, it was great having a kitchette available, as well as microwave meals available 24 hours at the service desk. There were also laundry rooms and computer stations available. I appreciated that they let me check out at noon instead of 10am, so that I could get some sightseeing in without lugging my bags around.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: kimz92684
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Travelodge after a 14 hour flight from the US. It was 9AM, and we were a bit tired. It would have been nice if we could have gone to our room immediately but it seems they have a strict check in time or were fully booked. So we left our luggage and took a walk around for a few hours. We found the hotel to be in a decent location as far as being close to the Circular Quay and the Rocks. It was about a 10 minute walk, and since it was a Sunday, not too crowded. The room was fairly standard and clean. A double bed, tv, sink, fridge, and bathroom. Nothing too much to write about, but for the location and price, it was a great value. The only thing I was a bit unhappy about was the front desk. The girl had a difficult time suggesting restaurants, and we found it somewhat difficult to find a place to eat dinner late on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location - close to transport and city”
Reviews.Author: Beagle007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work event. The hotel is attached to the NSW Leagues Club. It has a gym, poker machines, Thai restuarant and the cheapest drinks in Sydney! Close to train for travel around the city and the Airport. Close to freeway direct to the airport - about $28 fare. Rooms are clean and basic - have a fridge and microwave along with tea and coffee making facilities. Beds are good and the staff are friendly and always helpful. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best bargain in town”
Reviews.Author: Dilbert450
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop in Australia and it was a pleasant surprise. For less than $100 a night on Expedia, we got this more than reasonable room of good size. Although not in the heart of the action, it's also not too far away - about a 20-minute walk from Circular Quay but 5 minutes only from CBD with restaurants and shops. Room was very clean and staff was professional. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Lejam
